ygData.subject: Re: Cash and experience
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually, I spent a lot of time in SK. Made several levels there hunting Aviaks. Did some Gnolls, but found them over-camped. I am high enough lvl now that SK
ygData.messageBody:
Actually, I spent a lot of time in SK. Made several levels there
hunting Aviaks. Did some Gnolls, but found them over-camped. I am
high enough lvl now that SK is a bit slow. I moved on the Brute
hunting for my tailoring, then started in Velious because the time
seemed right.

Barto Proudfoot

--- In EverQuest@y..., "Steve C." <cotten@h...> wrote:
> Have you tried South Karanas? It was good hunting for me at that
level. Lots
> of Aviarks and Knolls etc. Then I moved on to Great Divide and
started out
> hunting Tizmaks.
>
> Good luck!
> Steve
>
> Mage 45
> Kane Bayle
>
>
> Politics is the show business of industry. --Frank Zappa
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "mlockridge01" <MLockridge01@c...>
> To: <EverQuest@y...>
> Sent: Saturday, October 05, 2002 7:07 AM
> Subject: [EverQuest] Cash and experience
>
>
> > I have been hunting Snow Cougars in Iceclad for a level and a
half.
> > The experience is good, and whether solo or duo the time invested
is
> > about the same. Not bad, but I am not making any money.
> >
> > Previously I farmed Brutes in Warsliks Woods. Nominal experience,
but
> > made lots of cash.
> >
> > Any ideas where I can go as a lvl 35 Druid to get a good balance
of
> > cash/loot and experience? Mostly I solo, as I am usually in for an
> > hour at a time. Get in a few hours together now and then, but for
> > short sessions getting a group consumes most of the time
available.
> >
> > Barto Proudfoot
> >
